Articles.Content:
Thought I might set this one up as a secondary epic craft to the already existing Epic Stock Craft

Here's one of my First Gen of my reliable Phoenix Heavy Launcher series.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/9UtnF)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-05T17:58:27Z" title="03/05/2015 05:58  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 5, 2015</time> by Sampa**

![S16KMQL.png](http://i.imgur.com/S16KMQL.png)

![GqjROYO.png](http://i.imgur.com/GqjROYO.png)

I call it the Snow Cat Utility Truck. KAS, Proceedural Fairings, Karbonite, and Remote Tech required. Pre .90. Transports 7 Kerbals. Carries lots of tow cables and parts for rescuing and pulling things. I'm looking forward to developing a new Snow Cat soon.

It even came with a Cargo Airlifter IV I made to transport it and other cargo:

![nTWvWEh.png](http://i.imgur.com/nTWvWEh.png)

Here is the Cargo Airlifter after dropping off a Karbonite Mining Rig in the background at Area 51. The shuttlecraft in the midground is a modified Neutron (see my sig).

![xod0ljL.png](http://i.imgur.com/xod0ljL.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-05T02:28:50Z" title="03/05/2015 02:28  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 5, 2015</time> by inigma**

My pod racer, uses Kerbal attachment system and Kerbal foundries wheels and repulsors 

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O-QMPSTo0K0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Links to the craft/mods are in the video description.

I have a few.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/fEOj1)

I absolutely love this plane. It can handle ridiculously tight turns and can also fly quite fast.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/e0x8B)

It uses KerbPaint so I guess it counts.

![8VRgVJ3.png](http://i.imgur.com/8VRgVJ3.png)

Something I made a ridiculously long time ago that has since been lost in the bowels of my old save files ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).

![ERmhAUv.png](http://i.imgur.com/ERmhAUv.png)

Fuel tanks and SRBs are from Procedural Parts and the engines are Skippers with modified SSME exhaust from the Component Space Shuttle mod.

![Sln9aJj.png](http://i.imgur.com/Sln9aJj.png)

Saturn V that took ages. Made with Procedural Parts and Procedural Fairings.

![S7zpyZCl.png](http://i.imgur.com/S7zpyZCl.png)![qQXtXmwl.png](http://i.imgur.com/qQXtXmwl.png)![2ZcETQBl.png](http://i.imgur.com/2ZcETQBl.png)

Cool shots of S-IC and interstage separation.
